intro: Lappula redowskyi subsp. patula, commonly known as the slender lappula, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures. The subspecies is characterized by its distinct morphology and ecological preferences, making it a notable species in its native habitats.
